titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Alexander Dallin Papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Michael Jakobson; machine-readable finding aid created by James Ryan

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2018-02-06T11:23-0800

change.item: 2018 January 31: Added links to materials in the 2018 release of declassified records subseries that are available on digitalcollections.hoover.org. -Sally DeBauche <date calendar="gregorian" normal="20120801" era="ce">August 1, 2012</date><item>Revised to update encoding and add unitid</item></change><change><date calendar="gregorian" normal="20040323" era="ce">March 23, 2004</date><item>PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Alexander Dallin Papers)//EN" "reg_319.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).</item>

physdesc.extent: 361 manuscript boxes, 2 oversize boxes, 1 envelope, 1 microfilm reel

did.abstract: Writings, correspondence, memoranda, reports, orders, interview transcripts, notes, and printed matter, relating to the German occupation of areas of the Soviet Union during World War II, the Vlasov movement, and Soviet collaborators and partisans. Includes photocopies of German military documents. Used in preparation of the book by A. Dallin, German Rule in Russia, 1941-1945 (London, 1957). Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items, computer media, and digital files. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos, films, or digital files during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Alexander Dallin Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1979.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

altformavail.head: Alternate Forms Available
altformavail.p: Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

chronitem.event: B.S., College of the City of New York
Professor of International Relations, Columbia University
Author, The Soviet Union at the United Nations
Author, The Soviet Union and Disarmament
Co-Author, Political Terror in Communist Systems
Senior Research Fellow, Hoover Institution, Stanford University
Professor of History and Political Science, Stanford University

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Autobiography, bibliography, clippings essay, identification, instructions, interviews, leaflets, letters, lists of names, maps, memoirs, memoranda, minutes, orders, printed matter, proposals, questionnaires, radio bulletins, radio message, reports, resolutions, speeches, statistics, studies, summaries of discussions and conferences.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This addition to the collection has not yet been described. Please let the Hoover Institution Archives know if you would like to see this material described.
